citeinfo.origin: Digital Social Science Center (DSSC), Columbia University Libraries
citeinfo.title: Delhi and its Environs from Plan, and Other Original Materials, Transmitted from India, and the Surveys of the Honble. East India Company, 1857

descript.abstract: This is a scanned version of the 1857 paper map entitled: Delhi and its Environs from Plan, and Other Original Materials, Transmitted from India, and the Surveys of the Honble. East India Company. The map was scanned at 300 dots per inch and is in the TIFF format.
descript.purpose: Scanned maps may be used for a variety of purposes. This image may be used in a GIS.
descript.supplinf: 1 map : hand col., dissected and mounted on linen ; 36 x 50 cm., folded to 19 x 11 cm., in covers 20 x 11 cm. Scale [ca. 1:32,000]. Shows streets, quarters of British troops, fortifications, principal buildings./ Relief shown by hachures./ Oriented with north toward the lower right. Title on cover label:; Stanford's map of Delhi and its environs, constructed from the Ordnance plan, Map of the environs of Delhi, and other original materials transmitted from India.; Map of Delhi and its environs.

cntorgp.cntorg: Research Data Services (RDS), Columbia University Libraries

idinfo.datacred: Thanks to Prof. Frances Pritchett, Columbia University, for providing the original paper map for this scan.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3500

dataqual.logic: The raster image is a faithfully reproduced digital image of the original source map. Some differences may be detected between the source graphic used and the raster image due to the RGB values assigned that particular color. The intent is to recreate those colors as near as possible.
dataqual.complete: Data completeness for digitized paper map files reflect the content of the source graphic.

citeinfo.title: Delhi and its Environs from Plan, and Other Original Materials, Transmitted from India, and the Surveys of the Honble. East India Company

procstep.procdesc: Original map was scanned at 300 dpi and saved in .tiff format with Colortrac5480 Scanner
